mdRecord.dcterms:description: Facade and statue of George Washington

The Redwood Library and Athenaeum is a subscription library, museum, rare book repository and research center founded in 1747.... Designed by Peter Harrison and completed in March 1750, [it] was the first purposely built library in the United States, and the oldest neo-Classical building in the country. It has been in continuous use since its opening. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Redwood_Library_and_Athenaeum [work]
